intro: Ptychotis ajawain, commonly known as the Mexican spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or shrubland habitats. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Ptychotis ajawain is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
